intro: Helxine cordata, commonly known as the silver thread plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white fuzz. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Helxine cordata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
